facts.text: Astro ships zero JS by default to each page—hydrate components as islands only when needed.
Tailwind’s JIT compiles only the classes you use, keeping CSS payloads tiny.
Plotly can switch to WebGL for large scatter traces—great for high‑density data.
Streamlit supports custom components, so you can extend dashboards with React widgets.
Covering indexes speed up SELECTs when all needed columns are in the index itself.
Data leakage often hides in feature engineering. Always split before transforming.
Holographic UI trick: high contrast neon borders + subtle blur + noise = futuristic vibe.
An O(n log n) algorithm can win in practice if constants are small and cache‑friendly.
Conventional commits (+ semantic versioning) make changelogs and releases effortless.
Max drawdown shows worst peak‑to‑trough loss—vital for strategy risk profiles.
Use <link rel="preconnect"> for third‑party origins (fonts, APIs) to cut handshake time.
Respect prefers‑reduced‑motion: reduce parallax, long fades, and continuous animations.
Seeded PRNGs yield reproducible dashboards—great for demos and snapshot tests.
Clearance Level: Data Analyst/Computer Scientist — access to mission logs granted.
